channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16143] Change MemstoreScanner constructor to accept List<KeyValueScanner>
item.description: A minor change that helps in creating a memstore that avoids the compaction process and just allows to creates a pipeline of segments and on flush directly reads the segments in the pipeline and flushes it out after creating a snapshot of the pipeline. Based on test results and updated patch on HBASE-14921 (to be provided) will see how much flattening helps us.
item.summary: Change MemstoreScanner constructor to accept List<KeyValueScanner>

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch changing the constructor of MemstoreScanner and removing SegmentScanner#shouldSeek(). We could call the KeyValueScanner#shouldUseScanner() only instead.

So instead of SegmentScanner, a KVScanner is being used. SegmentScanner IS A KVScanner?
Change looks good
Nits: Not from ur patch but I feel we can clean up

getListOfScanners

Call it getScanners() No need to say data structure name in method name

LinkedList<KeyValueScanner> list = new LinkedList<KeyValueScanner>();

Make the type as List and new ArrayList? Dont think we need a LinkedList anyway.

Thanks for the quick review.

Call it getScanners() No need to say data structure name in method name

I could see that there is already a getScanners() API and getListOfScanners() is also something similar.

Make the type as List and new ArrayList? Dont think we need a LinkedList anyway.

Lets see. May be yes.
I think we could do more clean up in SegmentScanner. Will do in this patch only then.
Updated patch with changes to SegmentScanner and its API. Should be good to commit.

list.add(pos, getActive().getSegmentScanner(readPt, order+1));

Why use pos based add? It is ArrayList we know so we will get insert order. It is fine to just call add(<element>)

Where do u use MemstoreScanner now? Previous it was returning one MemstoreScanner to the StoreScannr layer.Now it is N KVScanners? Intended change?

-1 overall

Why use pos based add? It is ArrayList we know so we will get insert order. It is fine to just call add(<element>)

Ok. will change. I just used the way it was done in DefaultMemstore.

Where do u use MemstoreScanner now? Previous it was returning one MemstoreScanner to the StoreScannr layer.Now it is N KVScanners? Intended change?

I verified. No problem any where. It should be fine. But to ensure that we don't introduce such a big change with this patch (though it is right it causes confusion) - I will just wrap the list into a MemstoreScanner and return a singleton list as it was done before.

Why use pos based add? It is ArrayList we know so we will get insert order. It is fine to just call add(<element>)

Ok. will change. I just used the way it was done in DefaultMemstore.

Where do u use MemstoreScanner now? Previous it was returning one MemstoreScanner to the StoreScannr layer.Now it is N KVScanners? Intended change?

I verified. No problem any where. It should be fine. But to ensure that we don't introduce such a big change with this patch (though it is right it causes confusion) - I will just wrap the list into a MemstoreScanner and return a singleton list as it was done before.

minor

public abstract List<KeyValueScanner> getScanners(long readPt) throws IOException;

You don't need this. It is already there in Memstore interface.
